While standard analgesics reduced grimacing, CP-99994 had limited effect on this spontaneous pain measure despite reducing evoked allodynia, suggesting facial grimacing may better predict analgesic potential and reduce translational failures.

Controversies in Genicular Nerve Radiofr.title: Navigating current controversies in radiofrequency ablation of the genicular nerves for chronic knee pain in osteoarthritis: a daring discourse.
Controversies in Genicular Nerve Radiofr.author: Ferreira-Silva N; Ferreira-Dos-Santos G; Cunat T; Ribeiro-da-Silva T; Peng P
Controversies in Genicular Nerve Radiofr.abstract_summary: This article provides a critical analysis of ongoing debates surrounding radiofrequency ablation (RFA) of genicular nerves for chronic knee osteoarthritis pain. It addresses key controversies such as the role of prognostic blocks, optimal target sites, nerve selection, guidance techniques, and the use of pulsed RFA to guide clinical decision-making and future research.

Chronic Itch and Natriuretic Peptide B U.title: Upregulated natriuretic peptide B expression as a hallmark of chronic itch.
Chronic Itch and Natriuretic Peptide B U.author: Tseng PY; Liew HL; Ringkamp M; Nagao K; Hoon MA
Chronic Itch and Natriuretic Peptide B U.abstract_summary: This study analyzed transcriptomic data from multiple animal models of chronic itch and pain to identify common molecular features. The results revealed that upregulation of Nppb expression in sensory neurons is a consistent and selective feature of chronic itch models, but not pain models, suggesting Nppb could serve as a conserved biomarker for chronic itch.

Sleep Interventions for Fibromyalgia Pai.title: Analgesic benefits of pharmacological and nonpharmacological sleep interventions for adults with fibromyalgia: a systematic review and meta-analyses.
Sleep Interventions for Fibromyalgia Pai.author: Abolhosseini S; Malatesta A; Asmundson AJN; Gilron I; Salomons TV
Sleep Interventions for Fibromyalgia Pai.abstract_summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis evaluated whether sleep-focused interventions improve pain outcomes in adults with fibromyalgia. The review found that sodium oxybate and cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for insomnia both significantly improved pain compared to inactive controls, providing preliminary support for the analgesic benefits of certain sleep interventions.

B Cell-IgG-FcgammaR Signaling in Neuropa.title: Autoreactive immunoglobulin G levels and Fc receptor gamma subunit upregulation drive mechanical allodynia after nerve constriction or crush injury.
B Cell-IgG-FcgammaR Signaling in Neuropa.author: Fiore NT; Willcox KF; Grieco AR; Dayani D; Zuberi YA; Heijnen CJ; Grace PM
B Cell-IgG-FcgammaR Signaling in Neuropa.abstract_summary: This study in mice investigated the role of B cell-IgG-FcgammaR signaling in mechanical allodynia across different peripheral nerve injury models. It demonstrates a divergent role, where B cell depletion prevents allodynia after constriction and crush injuries but not after transection injuries, linked to differential upregulation of the Fc receptor gamma subunit.

Mouse Model for Catheter-Associated UTI.title: A catheter-associated urinary tract infection mouse model to study bladder dysfunction and pain.
Mouse Model for Catheter-Associated UTI.author: Schillebeeckx L; Caldwell A; Luyten K; Sliwinska M; Gevaert T; Everaerts W; Voets T
Mouse Model for Catheter-Associated UTI.abstract_summary: This study developed a novel female mouse suprapubic catheter-associated urinary tract infection (CAUTI) model to study bladder pain and dysfunction. The model successfully recapitulates clinical symptoms, including sustained bacterial infection, biofilm formation, bladder hypersensitivity, and voiding dysfunction, providing a valuable tool for researching new therapies.

STIM1 and TRPA1 in Nociception.title: STIM1 functionally couples to transient receptor potential ankyrin 1 contributing to nociception.
STIM1 and TRPA1 in Nociception.author: Mei Y; Birla H; Lee BH; Li Z; Rai V; Zhang I; Huo X; Yi A; Zhang Q; Li D; Zhong Y; Wang F; Yasin B; Apai C; Rohacs T; Tao YX; Bekker A; Hu H
STIM1 and TRPA1 in Nociception.abstract_summary: This study reveals a novel link between the calcium sensor STIM1 and the ion channel TRPA1 in nociceptors. It demonstrates that STIM1 functionally couples to TRPA1 in the endoplasmic reticulum, mediating store-operated calcium entry and contributing to the sensing of cold, chemical, and noxious mechanical stimuli in mice.

Neurophysiological Encoding of Aversive.title: Neurophysiological encoding of aversive prediction errors.
Neurophysiological Encoding of Aversive.author: Gopalakrishnan R; Sonneborn C; Baillet S; Machado AG; Wager TD; Roy M
Neurophysiological Encoding of Aversive.abstract_summary: Using MEG and computational modeling, this study investigated the neurophysiological basis of aversive prediction errors (PE) during a pain avoidance task. Findings indicate that aversive PE signals are rapidly generated in the alpha band by the midbrain, orbitofrontal cortex, and prefrontal cortex, which also encode pain expectations, facilitating learning to avoid future pain.

Microglial Reactivity and Sustained Pain.title: A combined activity of peripheral nociceptive and nonnociceptive neurons is necessary to trigger spinal microglial reactivity and sustained pain.
Microglial Reactivity and Sustained Pain.author: Isler M; Chu Sin Chung P; Deftu AF; Kirschmann G; Decosterd I; Suter MR
Microglial Reactivity and Sustained Pain.abstract_summary: This study investigated what triggers spinal microglial reactivity, a key step in chronic pain development. Using selective fiber activation in mice, the research demonstrates that simultaneous activation of both nociceptive and non-nociceptive fibers, not either one alone, is required to induce sustained hypersensitivity and a spinal microglia response.

Untreated Course of Chronic Pain.title: Understanding the untreated course of adults with chronic pain seeking psychological intervention: a systematic review and meta-analysis.
Untreated Course of Chronic Pain.author: Morgan Z; Scott A; Bisby MA; Chandra S; Hathway T; Correa AB; Dear BF
Untreated Course of Chronic Pain.abstract_summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis examined symptom changes in waitlist control groups from RCTs of psychological pain management. The findings from 52 studies suggest that, contrary to some reports, chronic pain symptoms are relatively stable and do not significantly deteriorate or improve over short waiting periods, providing valuable information for service planning and benchmarking.

Peripheral Nerve Stimulation Trialing Ap.title: To trial or not to trial before peripheral nerve stimulation for chronic pain: a retrospective multicenter comparative analysis of temporary-to-permanent and direct-to-permanent implantation approaches.
Peripheral Nerve Stimulation Trialing Ap.author: D'Souza RS; Yu Y; Singh V; Karri J; Javed S; Her YF; Chai N; Hoffmann C; Warner DO; Hussain N
Peripheral Nerve Stimulation Trialing Ap.abstract_summary: This retrospective multicenter study compared outcomes of two peripheral nerve stimulation (PNS) approaches: temporary trial followed by permanent implant (TTP) versus direct permanent implant (DTP). The analysis found no evidence that the TTP approach was associated with superior pain relief or reduced opioid consumption at 6 months compared to the DTP approach, questioning the necessity of routine trialing.

Frailty as a Perioperative Risk Factor.title: Frailty and perioperative outcomes: SNAP-3 as a call to action.
Frailty as a Perioperative Risk Factor.author: McIsaac DI; Amado L
Frailty as a Perioperative Risk Factor.abstract_summary: This article discusses the findings from the SNAP-3 study, which confirms frailty as a key risk factor for adverse outcomes in older surgical patients. It serves as a call to action for anaesthetists to identify at-risk patients and for researchers to develop and evaluate interventions to improve outcomes for this growing population.

Frailty as a Perioperative Risk Factor.title: Frailty in the perioperative setting: lessons from SNAP-3.
Frailty as a Perioperative Risk Factor.author: Howell SJ; Dhesi JK
Frailty as a Perioperative Risk Factor.abstract_summary: This review summarizes the key findings of the SNAP-3 study, the largest UK study on frailty and postoperative outcomes in older adults. Frailty, present in one-fifth of patients, was strongly associated with increased length of stay, delirium, and mortality, highlighting the need for routine frailty screening and targeted perioperative services.

Long-term Benzodiazepine Use and Postope.title: Long-term and pre-operative benzodiazepine use in older adults and risk for postoperative delirium: An additional analysis of the multicentre Biomarker Development for Postoperative Cognitive Impairment in the Elderly Study.
Long-term Benzodiazepine Use and Postope.author: Starks SCE; Pohrt A; Halzl-Yurek F; Heinrich M; Muller A; Spies CD; Winterer G; Zacharias N
Long-term Benzodiazepine Use and Postope.abstract_summary: This analysis of the BioCog cohort study investigated the association between benzodiazepine use and postoperative delirium (POD) in older adults. The study found that long-term benzodiazepine use was significantly associated with an increased risk of developing POD, whereas short-term use as a premedicant was not.

ASA Status, Age, and Surgical Outcomes.title: Age, ASA physical status and surgical outcomes: insights from a nationwide cohort study.
ASA Status, Age, and Surgical Outcomes.author: Kilhamn N; Eriksson J; von Oelreich E; Jonsson Fagerlund M; Oldner A; Larsson E
ASA Status, Age, and Surgical Outcomes.abstract_summary: This nationwide Swedish cohort study analyzed the relationship between ASA physical status, age, and postoperative mortality in over 460,000 adult surgical patients. The results demonstrate a very strong association between higher ASA physical status and increased 30-day and 365-day mortality across all age groups, reinforcing its importance in perioperative risk stratification.

Trends in Total Joint Arthroplasty for O.title: Trends in Comorbidities and Complications Among Octogenarians and Nonagenarians Undergoing Primary Total Joint Arthroplasty in the United States.
Trends in Total Joint Arthroplasty for O.author: Reisinger L; Cozowicz C; Zhong H; Illescas A; Giannakis P; Memtsoudis SG; Poeran J; Liu J
Trends in Total Joint Arthroplasty for O.abstract_summary: This study analyzed trends in total knee and hip arthroplasty (TKA/THA) for patients aged 80 and older from 2006 to 2022. Despite these very old patients often having fewer comorbidities than the typical 65-70 year-old recipients, advanced age itself remained a significant independent risk factor for major postoperative complications.

Digital Health Interventions in Ambulato.title: Post discharge digital health technology interventions in ambulatory surgery: A systematic review and meta-analysis.
Digital Health Interventions in Ambulato.author: Bentsen SB; Stjernberg M; Raeder J; Eide GE; Tvedt MN; Hegland PA
Digital Health Interventions in Ambulato.abstract_summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis evaluated the effects of post-discharge digital health interventions (DHIs) for ambulatory surgery patients. While DHIs did not significantly impact pain or unplanned healthcare encounters, individual studies suggest they may reduce some symptoms, lower costs, and improve quality of life, though evidence certainty is low.

ICU Admission Rates and Outcomes in RRS.title: Impact of the Standardized ICU Admission Ratio on Outcomes in Rapid Response System Activations: A Retrospective Multicenter Study in Japan.
ICU Admission Rates and Outcomes in RRS.author: Ono S; Uchino S; Tokito M; Saito T; Sasabuchi Y; Sanui M
ICU Admission Rates and Outcomes in RRS.abstract_summary: This multicenter retrospective study in Japan examined the association between institutional ICU admission rates after Rapid Response System (RRS) activation and patient outcomes. The study found that a higher Standardized ICU Admission Ratio (SIAR) was significantly associated with a lower incidence of poor neurological outcome or death, suggesting greater ICU utilization after RRS calls may improve outcomes.

Outcomes of Alcohol-Related Liver Diseas.title: Outcomes for patients with alcohol-related liver disease admitted to Scottish intensive care units 2010-2018.
Outcomes of Alcohol-Related Liver Diseas.author: Shariff A; Rhode S; Forbes SJ; Lone N; Docherty A
Outcomes of Alcohol-Related Liver Diseas.abstract_summary: This secondary data analysis of Scottish ICU databases evaluated outcomes for patients with alcohol-related liver disease (ARLD). It found that ARLD patients had significantly higher ICU and 60-day mortality, especially with multi-organ support, although outcomes were better for those admitted with a gastrointestinal bleed, suggesting a trial of organ support may be appropriate in certain cases.

Ketamine Analgo-sedation Guidelines for.title: Ketamine Analgo-sedation for Mechanically Ventilated Critically Ill Adults: A Rapid Practice Guideline from the Saudi Critical Care Society and the Scandinavian Society of Anesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine.
Ketamine Analgo-sedation Guidelines for.author: Amer M; Hylander Moller M; Alshahrani M; Shehabi Y; Arabi YM; Alshamsi F; Ingi Sigurethsson M; Rehn M; Chew MS; Kalliomaki ML; Lewis K; Al-Suwaidan FA; Al-Dorzi HM; Al-Fares A; Alsadoon N; Bell CM; Groth CM; Parke R; Mehta S; Wischmeyer PE; Al-Omari A; Olkkola KT; Alhazzani W
Ketamine Analgo-sedation Guidelines for.abstract_summary: This Rapid Practice Guideline provides recommendations for using ketamine for analgo-sedation in mechanically ventilated ICU adults. Based on a systematic review, the panel issued conditional recommendations against using ketamine as monotherapy but suggested it may be used as an adjunct to other sedatives, highlighting the very low certainty of evidence and need for more research.

Perioperative Cardiac Arrest in ICU Admi.title: Perioperative cardiac arrest requiring admission to intensive care units in Japan: epidemiological differences between emergency and elective surgery.
Perioperative Cardiac Arrest in ICU Admi.author: Anezaki H; Aoki Y; Kato H; Nakajima M; Kaszynski RH; Suzuki K; Yamaguchi T; Naruse S; Kimura T; Mimuro S; Nakajima Y
Perioperative Cardiac Arrest in ICU Admi.abstract_summary: This nationwide study in Japan analyzed the epidemiology of perioperative cardiac arrest in patients admitted to the ICU after surgery. The research found significant differences between emergency and elective surgeries, with emergency cases having a much higher incidence (1.74% vs 0.17%), different primary etiologies, and significantly worse in-hospital mortality.

Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs) in Resear.title: DAGs for dummies: how to extract causation from correlation.
Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs) in Resear.author: Gaskell A; Sleigh J
Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs) in Resear.abstract_summary: This article introduces the foundational principles of directed acyclic graphs (DAGs) as a tool for causal inference in observational research. It explains how DAGs help researchers map assumptions about confounders, mediators, and colliders to guide appropriate variable selection, reduce bias, and strengthen causal claims from correlational data.

Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire for A.title: Development and internal validation of the patient satisfaction questionnaire: Perception of Quality in Anaesthesia (PQA)-10.
Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire for A.author: Kesting M; Sharma N; Debelak R; Braun J; Spahn DR; Tscholl DW; Fredrich H; Gasciauskaite G; Lunkiewicz J
Patient Satisfaction Questionnaire for A.abstract_summary: This study details the development and validation of the Perception of Quality in Anaesthesia (PQA-10) questionnaire in Switzerland. Through patient input and thematic analysis, a 10-item tool was created that reliably and validly assesses patient satisfaction across three key domains: pre-anesthetic communication, side-effects, and anaesthesia team skills.

Intra-operative Ventilation Strategies.title: Intra-operative ventilation strategies and their impact on clinical outcomes: a systematic review and network meta-analysis of randomised trials.
Intra-operative Ventilation Strategies.author: Jivraj NK; Lakbar I; Sadeghirad B; Muller MM; Sohn SY; Peel JK; Jaffer A; Phoophiboon V; Trivedi V; Chaudhuri D; Lu C; Liu Y; Giammarioli B; Einav S; Burns KEA
Intra-operative Ventilation Strategies.abstract_summary: This systematic review and network meta-analysis of 51 RCTs evaluated intra-operative ventilation strategies to prevent postoperative pulmonary complications (PPCs). The study found that low tidal volume strategies, when combined with various PEEP levels, likely reduce the risk of PPCs compared to high tidal volume with zero PEEP, highlighting the need for wider implementation of lung protective ventilation.

Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity (LAST.title: The impact of local anesthetic systemic toxicity advisories on reporting to the National Poison Data System (NPDS).
Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity (LAST.author: Fettiplace M; Weinberg G; Nixon H; Barabanova A; Chiang C; Gitman M
Local Anesthetic Systemic Toxicity (LAST.abstract_summary: This study analyzed reports to the National Poison Data System to assess the impact of 2010 advisories on local anesthetic systemic toxicity (LAST). While overall poisoning reports decreased, reports of lidocaine poisoning and mortality increased, particularly from intravenous delivery in emergency settings, highlighting a need for improved guidance on lidocaine use.

Recruitment-to-Inflation Ratio for Lung.title: Evaluation of the potential for lung recruitment with the Recruitment-to-Inflation ratio during general anesthesia.
Recruitment-to-Inflation Ratio for Lung.author: Rosa T; Menga LS; Mastropietro C; Settanni D; Russo A; Frassanito L; Cascarano L; Catarci S; Delle Cese L; Zanfini BA; Scaramuzzo G; Dell'Anna AM; Spadaro S; Antonelli M; Grieco DL
Recruitment-to-Inflation Ratio for Lung.abstract_summary: This study evaluated the recruitment-to-inflation ratio (R/I) as a tool to assess lung recruitability during general anesthesia for open abdominal surgery. The findings indicate that R/I reliably estimates the potential for lung recruitment and can help identify patients in whom higher PEEP levels may improve respiratory physiology and favor less injurious ventilation.

Microglia-Neuronal Communication in Musc.title: Microglia-neuronal communication mediated by P2X4R-BDNF-TrkB promotes synaptic plasticity and anterior cingulate cortex hyperactivity in muscle pain chronicity.
Microglia-Neuronal Communication in Musc.author: Liang Y; Luo M; Xu Q; Zhang S; Niu S; Li X; Sun W; Song M; Wang L; Xing X; Wang J; Feng M; Zhao L; Chen H; Sheng R; Wang Y
Microglia-Neuronal Communication in Musc.abstract_summary: This study investigated the role of microglia-neuronal communication in the anterior cingulate cortex (ACC) in a rat model of chronic muscle pain. It identified that the P2X4R-BDNF-TrkB signaling pathway enhances synaptic plasticity and cortical hyperactivity, and that suppressing this ACC hyperactivity can alleviate chronic muscle pain and associated anxiety-like behaviors.
